Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-04-23T19:51:45Description is in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Springfield Cooperative Society Records
Springfield Cooperative Society (Springfield, Mass.)
TAM.045
0.5 Linear Feet (1 box)
1911-1921 The Springfield Cooperative Society, founded in 1911, was a consumer cooperative for the purchase of clothing, coal, and groceries. Fragmentary records found here are constitutions, correspondence, financial records, minutes of board of directors meetings, and stock certificates.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Transferred from the Rand School Archives, 1963. There is no earlier provenance information. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.104.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
[Repository] has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1911-1921, are expected to enter the public domain in 2042.
Historical/Biographical Note
The Springfield Cooperative Society (Springfield, Mass.), founded in 1911, was a consumer cooperative for the purchase of clothing, coal, and groceries.
Scope and Content Note
The collection contains fragmentary records, including constitutions, correspondence, financial records, minutes of board of directors meetings, and stock certificates.
Arrangement
Folders are arranged alphabetically.
The files are organized into 1 series:
Missing Title
I, Records, 1911-1921.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Springfield Cooperative Society Records; TAM 045; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
